amendment.description: Amendment prohibits funds from being used to compel employers to pay backpay to employees who were not lawfully entitled to be present and employed in the United States.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 18 in the Congressional Record of July 9, 1996, to prohibit the National Labor Relations Board from directing any employer to pay backpay to any employee for any period the employee was not lawfully entitled to be present and employed in the United States.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Campbell amendment (A033) Agreed to by voice vote.
